conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B, analyze the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Identify the velocity-time graph for object B as the curve labeled B.
At t = 0, the slope of curve B is positive, indicating initial positive acceleration.
From t = 0 to t1, the slope of curve B decreases, indicating decreasing acceleration to zero at t1.
From t1 to t2, the slope of curve B becomes negative, indicating negative acceleration increasing in magnitude.
Summarize: From t = 0 to t1, acceleration decreases from positive to zero; from t1 to t2, it increases to negative.
The trend of acceleration of object B is it decreases from a positive value to zero and then increases to a negative value.
